data.text: How do we tackle #globalinequality in the 21st century? IMF Chief Economist Gita Gopinath shares the stage with our 2 F&D magazine essay contest winners  https://t.co/sn1mxld9dw … | @CNBC #IMFYouth #IMFmeetings

#Mustwatch: on Oct 16 we discussed the role central banks can play in fighting #ClimateChange. Tune in for a lively discussing feat. @KGeorgieva @1sakhtar @ecb's Philip Lane @bundesbank's Sabine Mauderer & @gilliantett of @FT https://t.co/L5QqnB37Su #ClimateFinance #IMFmeetings

 and Min Zhu for a deep dive conversation on the global outlook. https://t.co/dwDXVZUlMs #GlobalEcon

.@KGeorgieva on the Global Policy Agenda: the focus now must be on finding lasting solutions to trade disputes and seeking domestic policies that build resilient & inclusive economies. We will continue to help countries design better policies. #IMFMeetings https://t.co/RxMtcNkwGJ https://t.co/FLouFOVqPY

IMF’s Abebe Selassie had constructive discussion on issues concerning #debt, social protection, #inequality, #growth, and taxation with CSO, academic and youth representatives from Sub-Saharan Africa participating in the #IMFMeetings as part of our fellowship program. #IMFAfrica https://t.co/TjhYgrLws3

.@KGeorgieva @ CSO Townhall: I will maintain close engagement with civil society in my new role at the IMF—we may not always agree on specific policies but your views will continue to be heard and considered in our policy discussions

IMF’s Tao Zhang: The #SDDS subscription is an important milestone for Saudi Arabia ahead of #G20 presidency. I congratulate the authorities for their commitment to data transparency and adoption of international best practices in statistics. #IMFMeetings https://t.co/1GlBbbJPyH

The lower-for-longer rate environment gives emerging markets easy access to financing, but it also encourages an excessive buildup of debt. #GFSR https://t.co/xoLknlKEuW https://t.co/brDFJLa3Yz
Low yields prompt investors to seek riskier investments to meet their return targets. This could have a negative impact on financial stability #GFSR https://t.co/phHA1b9OLR https://t.co/EjKF0crBda

Global economic growth is expected to slow to 3% in 2019. Why is the economy slowing down, and what can countries do to support growth? Watch this #WEO video and read the #IMFBlog https://t.co/xErxkTQ8xX https://t.co/5X4RnsCMsP

Global growth for 2019 has been downgraded again to 3% and is projected to improve modestly to 3.4 in 2020, a downward revision of 0.2% from April projections. Read the latest #WEO https://t.co/BbiyJkpJ1M https://t.co/atrMFe6uD0

To achieve the #SDGs, low-income developing countries will require additional spending amounting to 15% of their combined GDP by 2030―or about half a trillion US dollars. Carbon taxes are the most powerful and efficient tools to mitigate #ClimateChange, but only if they are implemented in a fair and growth-friendly way. Find out what governments can do to curb climate change in our #FiscalMonitor. https://t.co/xemiYJVwSf #IMFblog https://t.co/CnthlSWiRO

Reforms work best if properly timed, packaged, and sequenced. And they typically deliver larger gains in #Emerging market and #Developing economies where governance is stronger. Read more #IMFBlog #WEO https://t.co/YG4DiJijx2 https://t.co/CYlRjcPoJM
